Andresa Viana Ramos

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6521360661286527
  • Última atualização do currículo em 15/04/2019

Engenheira de Agronegócios formada pela Universidade Federal Fluminense (2011), mestre em Ciência de Alimentos pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro e doutora em Engenharia Química e de Processos pela University College Cork. Areas de interesse incluem polímeros aplicados a industria de alimentos e embalagens de alimentos. Atualmente é professora assistente no departamento de Process and Chemical Engineering na UCC - University College Cork. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2014 - Atual
Development of risk assessment tools of package/product systems for a safe and sustainable food chain
Descrição: Every year one third of all fresh produce is lost along the supply chain. This desktop project will develop strategies for packaging systems during the cold chain through the implementation of statistical process control at key points to ensure food safety and integrity within the overall food supply chain. It will be possible to develop robust product/package/supply chain systems, that is, packages that serve as redundancy safety systems by ensuring that failures in the chain do not result in loss of safety, quality and therefore minimise produce loss. Modified atmosphere packaging (MAP) is a technique that relies on the interplay between the respiratory metabolism of the product and the gas exchange kinetics through the package in order to achieve an optimum gas composition. This can help extend shelf life and reduce product loss. MAP as a technology has been studied for many years, but only recently efforts were made to integrate respiratory and film permeability data into predictive models for package gas compositions over time, as well as the effects of temperature. Nonetheless, most models today still do not include calculations to account for the effect of these compositions and temperature changes in the shelf life and quality decay of fresh produce. The goal of this project is to design and build up an integrated software platform for MAP design which considers the Quality by Design (QbD) approach, whose final goal is to include shelf life and quality loss considerations in the MAP design of fresh produce..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Mestrado acadêmico: (2) / Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Andresa Viana Ramos - Integrante / Maria Jose Sousa-Gallagher - Coordenador / Jorge C. Oliveira - Integrante.
